publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6750 Stuart McMillan: The Open Boosts Tourism and Charities Benefit—That the Parliament recognises the impact on tourism that the highlight of the British golfing calendar, the Open, had; notes the estimated £80 million that the tournament was on track to deliver for the Scottish economy; further notes that Cancer Research UK benefited from the tournament, raising over £10,000 for the Seve Ballesteros Foundation over 6 days of the championship; acknowledges the work that Cancer Research UK is doing in conjunction with the Seve Foundation in research into brain cancer, and wishes them well in future fundraising efforts in the name of Open winner Seve Ballesteros. Supported by: Jim Tolson*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Pringle*, Gil Paterson*, Stewart Maxwell*, Rob Gibson*, Bob Doris*, Brian Adam*, Anne McLaughlin*, Ross Finnie*, Bill Kidd*
